original: Samīpacārīti idaṃ purimapadasseva vevacanaṃ. Yesaṃ so bhavaṃ gotamoti kasmā pucchati?🔽Tassa kira evaṃ ahosi “yesu dhammesu bhavaṃ gotamo imaṃ lokaṃ patiṭṭhapesi, te tassa
analyzed: samīpa cārī iti idam purima padassa iva vevacanam yesam saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ iti kasmai pucchati  tassa kira evam ahosi yesu dhammesu bhavam gotamaḥ imam lokam patiṭṭhapesi te tassa
translated: Why does he ask, “Whose is this venerable Gotama”?

original: accayena naṭṭhā nu kho, dharanti nu kho, sace dharanti, ānando jānissati, handa naṃ
analyzed: accayena naṭṭhā nu kho dharanti nu kho sace dharanti ānandaḥ jānissati handa nam
translated: It seems that he thought as follows: “The venerable Gotama established this world in dhammas. When he is gone, will those dhammas be lost or will they endure? If they endure, Ananda will know it. Let me ask him.”

original: pucchāmī”ti, tasmā pucchi.
analyzed: pucchāmi iti tasmai pucchi
translated: Therefore he asked.

original: 449. Athassa thero tīṇi piṭakāni tīhi khandhehi saṅgahetvā dassento “tiṇṇaṃ kho”tiādimāha.
analyzed: athassa theraḥ tīṇi piṭakāni tīhi khandhehi saṅgahetvā dassentaḥ tiṇṇam kho ti ādim āha

original: Māṇavo saṅkhittena kathitaṃ asallakkhento – “vitthārato pucchissāmī”ti cintetvā “katamesaṃ tiṇṇa”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: māṇavaḥ saṅkhittena kathitam a sat lakkhentaḥ vitthārato pucchissāmi iti cintetvā katamesam tiṇṇa nti ādim āha
translated: Not understanding the meaning of the brief statement, the brahmin thought, “I will ask him to explain in detail.” So he asked, “Which three? “

analyzed: sīla khandha vaṇṇanā  tatas therena ariyassa sīlakkhandhassa ati tesu dassitesu puna katamo pana

analyzed: saḥ bho ānanda ariyaḥ sīlakkhandho ti ekekam pucchi theraḥ upissa buddhuppādam dassetvā
translated: . Then, when the venerable Ananda had pointed out the three, the brahmin asked him about each one in turn, beginning thus, “But, Reverend Ananda, what is this noble aggregate of virtue? “

original: tantidhammaṃ desento anukkamena bhagavatā vuttanayeneva sabbaṃ vissajjesi. Tattha🔽atthi cevettha uttarikaraṇīyanti ettha bhagavato sāsane na sīlameva sāro, kevalañhetaṃ
analyzed: tanti dhammam desentaḥ anukkamena bhagavatā vutta nayena iva sabbam vissajjesi tattha  atthi ceva itthā ettha bhagavato sāsane na sīlam eva sāraḥ
translated: The venerable Ananda, in reply, pointed out the origin of the Buddha’s dispensation,🔽and then he explained the three aggregates in the order stated in the suttas, beginning with the aggregate of virtue. Herein,

original: patiṭṭhāmattameva hoti. Ito uttari pana aññampi kattabbaṃ atthi yevāti dassesi. Ito
analyzed: patiṭṭhā mattam eva hoti itas uttari pana aññam pi kattabbam atthi yeva ati dassesi itas
translated: there is still more to be done: here the Blessed One shows that virtue is not the only essence in his dispensation; it is only the foundation. But there is still more to be done besides virtue.

original: bahiddhāti buddhasāsanato bahiddhā.
analyzed: bahiddhā iti buddha sāsanataḥ bahiddhā
translated: Outside: outside the Buddha’s dispensation.

original: Samādhikkhandhavaṇṇanā
analyzed: samādhi khandha vaṇṇanā
translated: The section on concentration

original: 454. Kathañca, māṇava, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvāro hotīti idamāyasmā ānando “katamo
analyzed: kathañca māṇava bhikkhu indriyesu gutta dvāraḥ hoti iti idam āyasmai ānando katamo
translated: . And how, student, does a bhikkhu guard the doors of his sense faculties? Herein, the venerable Ananda said this.

original: pana so, bho ānanda, ariyo samādhikkhandho”ti evaṃ samādhikkhandhaṃ puṭṭhopi ye te
analyzed: pana saḥ bho ānanda ariyaḥ samādhi khandhaḥ ti evam samādhi khandham puṭṭhaḥ upi ye te
translated: But that, Reverend Ananda, is the Noble Ones’ System of Concentration.”🔽When he was asked about the Concentration Category, he pointed out the Virtue Category, saying:

original: “sīlasampanno indriyesu guttadvāro satisampajaññena samannāgato santuṭṭho”ti evaṃ🔽sīlānantaraṃ indriyasaṃvarādayo sīlasamādhīnaṃ antare ubhinnampi upakārakadhammā🔽uddiṭṭhā, te niddisitvā samādhikkhandhaṃ dassetukāmo ārabhi. Ettha ca rūpajjhānāneva🔽āgatāni, na arūpajjhānāni, ānetvā pana dīpetabbāni. Catutthajjhānena hi asaṅgahitā
analyzed: sīla sampannaḥ indriyesu gutta dvāraḥ sati sampajaññena samannāgato santuṭṭhaḥ ti evam  sīla anantaram indriya saṃvara ādayaḥ sīla samādhīnam antare upakāraka dhammā  uddiṭṭhā te niddisitvā samādhi khandham dassetu kāmaḥ ārabhi ettha ca rūpa jhānāni eva  āgatāni na arūpa jhānāni ānetvā pana dīpetabbāni catuttha jhānena hi asaṅgahitā
translated: “One who has virtue, who guards the doors of his sense faculties, who is mindful and self-possessed, and who is content” .

original: arūpasamāpatti nāma natthiyeva.🔽471-480. Atthi cevettha uttarikaraṇīyanti ettha bhagavato sāsane na cittekaggatāmattakeneva🔽pariyosānappatti nāma atthi, itopi uttari pana aññaṃ kattabbaṃ atthi yevāti dasseti.
analyzed: arūpa samāpatti nāma natthiya iva  atthi ca iva itthā ettha bhagavatoḥ sāsane na citta ekagga tā mattakena iva  pariyosāna ppatti nāma atthi itas pi uttari pana aññam kattabbam atthi yeva ati dasseti
translated: The things that help both virtue and concentration, namely, restraint of the faculties, etc., are mentioned next to virtue in the Schedule, and so he began with them in order to point out the Concentration Category. And here only the form-sphere jhanas are mentioned, not the formless- jhana attainments, but they should be included. For there is no formless attainment that is not included in the fourth jhana.🔽“But there is still something further to be done” : here he shows that in the Blessed One’s dispensation the perfection is not reached by mere unification of mind. For there is still something else to be done besides that.

original: Natthi cevettha uttarikaraṇīyanti ettha bhagavato sāsane ito uttari kātabbaṃ nāma
analyzed: natthi ca iva ittha uttari karaṇīyanti ettha bhagavato sāsane itas uttari kātabbam nāma
translated: “But there is nothing further to be done” : here he shows that in the Blessed One’s dispensation there is nothing else to be done besides that.

original: natthiyeva, arahattapariyosānañhi bhagavato sāsananti dasseti. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānatthamevāti.
analyzed: natthiyā iva arahatta pariyosānam hi bhagavato sāsananti dasseti sesam sabbattha uttānattham eva ati
translated: he shows that there is no such thing, for the Dispensation of the Blessed One ends with arahatship. The rest is clear in meaning everywhere.

original: Iti sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: iti sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīgha nikāya ṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: So in the Long Division of the Great Elder’s Commentary,

analyzed: kevaṭṭa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Kevatta Sutta

analyzed: kevaṭṭa gaha pati putta vatthu vaṇṇanā  evam me sutaṃpe na āḷandāyanti kevaṭṭa suttam tatra ayam apubba pada vaṇṇanā pāvāri kambavanā iti
translated: The Story of the Householder Kevatta

original: pāvārikassa ambavane. Kevaṭṭoti idaṃ tassa gahapatiputtassa nāmaṃ. So kira cattālīsakoṭidhano🔽gahapatimahāsālo ativiya saddho pasanno ahosi. So saddhādhikattāyeva “sace eko bhikkhu🔽aḍḍhamāsantarena vā māsantarena vā saṃvaccharena vā ākāse uppatitvā vividhāni pāṭihāriyāni
analyzed: pāvārikassa ambavane kevaṭṭo ti idam tassa gahapati puttassa nāmam saḥ kira cattālīsa koṭi dhano  gahapati mahāsālaḥ ativiya saddhaḥ pasanno ahosi saḥ saddhā adhika ttāya iva sace ekaḥ bhikkhu  aḍḍha māsa antarena vā māsa antarena vā saṃvaccharena vā ākāse uppatitvā vividhāni pāṭihāriyāni
translated: Thus have I heard. … At Nalanda: the Kevatta Sutta. Herein, the exposition of the unfamiliar terms is this. In the mango grove of the Pava farmers’ is in the mango grove of the farmers of Pava. Kevatta is the name of that householder’s son. He was a great householder, it seems, worth four hundred million,

original: dasseyya, sabbo jano ativiya pasīdeyya. Yaṃnūnāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ yācitvā pāṭihāriyakaraṇatthāya
analyzed: dasseyya sabbaḥ janaḥ ativiya pasīdeyya yat nūna aham bhagavantam yācitvā pāṭihāriya karaṇa tthāya
translated: and he was extremely faithful and confident. Because of his great faith he thought, “If a bhikkhu were to fly up into the air by means of supernormal power and display various kinds of feats within half a month or a month or a year, the whole people would be extremely confident. Suppose I were to ask the Blessed One to display a miracle of supernormal power for the purpose of creating confidence in the people?”

original: ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ anujānāpeyya”nti cintetvā bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evamāha.🔽Tattha iddhāti samiddhā phītāti nānābhaṇḍaussannatāya vuddhippattā. Ākiṇṇamanussāti🔽aṃsakūṭena aṃsakūṭaṃ paharitvā viya vicarantehi manussehi ākiṇṇā. Samādisatūti āṇāpetu🔽ṭhānantare ṭhapetu. Uttarimanussadhammāti uttarimanussānaṃ dhammato, dasakusalasaṅkhātato🔽vā manussadhammato uttari. Bhiyyosomattāyāti pakatiyāpi pajjalitapadīpo telasnehaṃ
analyzed: ekam bhikkhum anujānāpeyya nti cintetvā bhagavantam upasaṅkamitvā evam āha  tattha iddhā ati samiddhā phītā ati nānā bhaṇḍa aussanna tāya vuddhi pattā ākiṇṇa manussā ti  aṃsa kūṭena aṃsa kūṭam paharitvā viya vicarantehi manussehi ākiṇṇā samādisatu uti āṇāpetu  ṭhāna antare ṭhapetu uttari manussa dhammā ti uttari manussānam dhammataḥ dasa kusala saṅkhātataḥ  vā manussadhammataḥ uttari bhiyyosomattāya ati pakatiyā api tela sneham
translated: and he thought, “I will ask the Lord to allow one monk to be appointed.” He went to the Lord and said:

original: labhitvā viya atirekappamāṇena abhippasīdissati. Na kho ahanti bhagavā rājagahaseṭṭhivatthusmiṃ🔽sikkhāpadaṃ paññapesi, tasmā “na kho aha”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: labhitvā viya atireka ppamāṇena abhippasīdissati na kho ahanti bhagavā rājagaha seṭṭhi vatthusmiṃ  sikkhāpadam paññapesi tasmai na kho aham tiādim āha
translated: Herein, prosperous means successful. Flourishing means having plenty of goods. Crowded with people means crowded with people going about as though striking each other’s shoulders. To appoint means to order. To another place means to another district. Higher than human dhamma means higher than the dhamma of human beings, or higher than the dhamma of the ten wholesome courses of action. To increase means to increase even more. As though a lamp were to burn with oil means as though a lamp that is already burning were to get oil and blaze up even more. I do not allow it means the Lord did not lay down a training precept as the treasurer of Rājagaha did, and so he said, “I do not allow it.”

original: 482. Na dhaṃsemīti na guṇavināsanena dhaṃsemi, sīlabhedaṃ pāpetvā anupubbena uccaṭṭhānato
analyzed: na dhaṃsemi iti na guṇa vināsanena dhaṃsemi sīlabhedam pāpetvā anupubbena ucca ṭṭhānato
translated: I do not destroy it means I do not destroy it by destroying its special qualities. I do not lead it to hell means I do not lead it to destruction by causing a breach of virtue.

original: otārento nīcaṭṭhāne na ṭhapemi, atha kho ahaṃ buddhasāsanassa vuddhiṃ paccāsīsanto
analyzed: otārentaḥ nīca ṭṭhāne na ṭhapemi atha kho aham buddha sāsanassa vuddhim paccāsīsantaḥ
translated: I do not place it in a low position. Rather, I am looking for the growth of the Buddha’s Dispensation.

original: kathemīti dasseti. Tatiyampi khoti yāvatatiyaṃ buddhānaṃ kathaṃ paṭibāhitvā kathetuṃ
analyzed: kathemi iti dasseti tatiyam pi kho ti yāvatatiyam buddhānam katham paṭibāhitvā kathetum
translated: I will speak.” The third time: as much as three times, there is no one who can prevent the Buddhas from speaking.

original: visahanto nāma natthi. Ayaṃ pana bhagavatā saddhiṃ vissāsiko vissāsaṃ vaḍḍhetvā vallabho
analyzed: visahantaḥ nāma natthi ayam pana bhagavatā saddhim vissāsikaḥ vissāsam vaḍḍhetvā vallabhaḥ
translated: But this lay follower, who was a friend of the Blessed One’s, increased his confidence in the Blessed One, and, having become a favourite,

original: hutvā atthakāmosmīti tikkhattuṃ kathesi.
analyzed: hutvā attha kāmo asmi iti tikkhattum kathesi
translated: he spoke three times, “I want to speak.”

original: Iddhipāṭihāriyavaṇṇanā
analyzed: iddhi pāṭihāriya vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Miracle of Psychic Power

original: 483-484. Atha bhagavā ayaṃ upāsako mayi paṭibāhantepi punappunaṃ yācatiyeva. “Handassa
analyzed: atha bhagavā ayam upāsakaḥ mayi paṭibāhante pi punappunam yācatiyā iva handassa
translated: Then the Blessed One thought, “This lay follower, though I have prevented him, asks me again and again. ‘Well then,

original: pāṭihāriyakaraṇe ādīnavaṃ dassemī”ti cintetvā “tīṇi kho”tiādimāha. Tattha amāhaṃ
analyzed: pāṭihāriya karaṇe ādīnavam dassemi iti cintetvā tīṇi kho ti ādim āha tattha
translated: I will show him the danger in my performing a miracle.’ So he said, ‘There are these three kinds of miracles, bhikkhus.’ Herein, I will speak to that bhikkhu:

original: bhikkhunti amuṃ ahaṃ bhikkhuṃ. Gandhārīti gandhārena nāma isinā katā, gandhāraraṭṭhe
analyzed: bhikkhum ti amum aham bhikkhum gandhārī iti gandhārena nāma isinā katā gandhāra raṭṭhe
translated: I will speak to that bhikkhu. The Gandhara: made by the seer named Gandhara, or arisen in the country of Gandhara,

original: vā uppannā vijjā. Tattha kira bahū isayo vasiṃsu, tesu ekena katā vijjāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: vā uppannā vijjā tattha kira bahū isayaḥ vasiṃsu tesu ekena katā vijjā ti adhippāyo
translated: where, it seems, many seers dwelt. The intention is that the knowledge was made by one of them.

original: Aṭṭīyāmīti aṭṭo pīḷito viya homi. Harāyāmīti lajjāmi. Jigucchāmīti gūthaṃ disvā viya jigucchaṃ uppādemi.
analyzed: aṭṭīyāmi iti aṭṭaḥ pīḍitaḥ viya homi harāyāmi iti lajjāmi jigucchāmi iti gūtham disvā viya jiguccham uppādemi
translated: I am ashamed, I am disgusted: I am ashamed as if I were ashamed of something shameful; I am disgusted as if I were disgusted by something disgusting.

original: Ādesanāpāṭihāriyavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ādesanā pāṭihāriya vaṇṇanā
translated: The miracle of reading thoughts

original: 485. Parasattānanti aññesaṃ sattānaṃ. Dutiyaṃ tasseva vevacanaṃ. Ādisatīti katheti.
analyzed: para sattānam ti aññesam sattānam dutiyam tassa iva vevacanam ādisati iti kathā iti
translated: Of other beings: of other people. The second is a synonym for the first. He tells: he says.

original: Cetasikanti somanassadomanassaṃ adhippetaṃ. Evampi te manoti evaṃ tava mano somanassito
analyzed: cetasikam ti somanassa domanassam adhippetam evam pi te mano ti evam tava mano somanassito
translated: In the mind: joy and grief are intended. So too your mind: thus your mind is joyful,

original: vā domanassito vā kāmavitakkādisampayutto vā. Dutiyaṃ tasseva vevacanaṃ. Itipi te
analyzed: vā domanassitaḥ vā kāma vitakka ādi sampayuttaḥ vā dutiyam tassa iva vevacanam te
translated: or sorrowful, or associated with sensual-desire thoughts, etc. The second is a synonym for the first. So too your thoughts: so too your thoughts,

original: cittanti iti tava cittaṃ, idañcidañca atthaṃ cintayamānaṃ pavattatīti attho. Maṇikā
analyzed: cittam iti tava cittam attham cintayamānam pavattati iti atthaḥ maṇikā
translated: your mind, are occurring as they reflect on this and that matter. The meaning is that they are occurring as they reflect on this and that matter.

original: nāma vijjāti cintāmaṇīti evaṃ laddhanāmā loke ekā vijjā atthi. Tāya paresaṃ cittaṃ jānātīti dīpeti.
analyzed: nāma vijjā ati cintāmaṇī iti evam laddha nāmā loke ekā vijjā atthi tāya paresam cittam jānāti iti dīpeti
translated: The spell called “The Jewel”: there is a spell called “The Wish-fulfilling Gem” in the world. It is said that by means of it one can know the minds of others.

original: Anusāsanīpāṭihāriyavaṇṇanā
analyzed: anusāsanī pāṭihāriya vaṇṇanā
translated: The miracle of instruction

original: 486. Evaṃ vitakkethāti nekkhammavitakkādayo evaṃ pavattentā vitakketha. Mā evaṃ vitakkayitthāti
analyzed: evam vitakketha ati nekkhamma vitakka ādayaḥ evam pavattentāḥ vitakketha mā evam vitakkayittha ati
translated: Think thus: think thoughts of renunciation, etc., occurring thus. Do not think thus:

original: evaṃ kāmavitakkādayo pavattentā mā vitakkayittha. Evaṃ manasi karothāti evaṃ aniccasaññameva,🔽dukkhasaññādīsu vā aññataraṃ manasi karotha. Mā evanti “nicca”ntiādinā nayena mā🔽manasi karittha. Idanti idaṃ pañcakāmaguṇikarāgaṃ pajahatha. Idaṃ upasampajjāti idaṃ
analyzed: evam kāma vitakka ādayaḥ pavattentāḥ mā vitakkayittha evam manasi karotha ati evam anicca saññam eva  dukkha saññā ādīsu vā aññataram manasi karotha mā evanti niccanti ādinā nayena mā  manasi idam ti idam pañca kāmaguṇika rāgam pajahatha idam upasampad jāti idam
translated: “Do not think like that” means: do not think in terms of sensual-desire-thoughts, etc. “Pay attention in this way” means: pay attention to the perception of impermanence,🔽or to one of the other perceptions beginning with that of suffering. “Do not pay attention in this way” means: do not pay attention in terms of permanence, etc. “This” refers to the lust for the five strands of sense pleasure. “Enter upon this” means: abandon this.

original: catumaggaphalappabhedaṃ lokuttaradhammameva upasampajja pāpuṇitvā nipphādetvā viharatha.🔽Iti bhagavā iddhividhaṃ iddhipāṭihāriyanti dasseti, parassa cittaṃ ñatvā kathanaṃ
analyzed: catu magga phala ppabhedam lokuttara dhammam eva upasampajja pāpuṇitvā nipphādetvā viharatha  iti bhagavā iddhi vidham iddhi pāṭihāriyanti dasseti parassa cittam ñatvā kathanaṃ
translated: “Do not think like this” means: do not think in the way of permanence, etc. “Do not pay attention” means: do not pay attention in the way of permanence, etc. “This” means: abandon this lust for the five strands of sense pleasure. “Enter upon this” means: enter upon, attain, realize, and abide in this supramundane Dhamma, which is divided into the four paths and the four fruits.

original: ādesanāpāṭihāriyanti. Sāvakānañca buddhānañca satataṃ dhammadesanā anusāsanīpāṭihāriyanti.
analyzed: ādesanā pāṭihāriyanti sāvakānam ca buddhānam ca satatam dhamma desanā anusāsanī pāṭihāriyanti
translated: Thus the Blessed One shows the various kinds of psychic power as the miracle of supernormal power, the revealing of his knowledge of the minds of others as the miracle of reading the minds of others, and the teaching of the Dhamma to his disciples and to others as the miracle of instruction.

original: Tattha iddhipāṭihāriyena anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṃ mahāmoggallānassa āciṇṇaṃ, ādesanāpāṭihāriyena
analyzed: tattha iddhi pāṭihāriyena anusāsanī pāṭihāriyam mahāmoggallānassa āciṇṇam ādesanā pāṭihāriyena
translated: Herein, the miracle of instruction is the province of Maha Moggallana through the miracle of supernormal power, and of the Buddhas through the miracle of reading the minds of others.

original: anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṃ dhammasenāpatissa. Devadatte saṃghaṃ bhinditvā pañca bhikkhusatāni
analyzed: anusāsanī pāṭihāriyam dhammasenāpatissa devadatte saṃgham bhinditvā pañca bhikkhu satāni
translated: The miracle of instruction is the Commander of the Dhamma’s. When Devadatta had split the Community and taken five hundred monks with him,

analyzed: gahetvā gayā sīse buddha līḷāya tesam dhammam desante hi bhagavatā pesitesu dvīsu aggasāvakesu
translated: and was teaching them the Dhamma on the Gayā Head, the Blessed One sent the two chief disciples

analyzed: dhammasenāpati tesam citta ācāram ñatvā dhammam desesi therassa dhamma desanam sutvā
translated: and the Commander of the Dhamma, knowing their thoughts and conduct, taught them the Dhamma. Having heard the elder’s teaching of the Dhamma,

analyzed: pañcasatā bhikkhū sotāpatti phale patiṭṭhahiṃsu atha nesam mahāmoggallānaḥ vikubbanam
translated: the five hundred monks were established in the fruit of stream-entry. Then Mahā Moggallāna,

analyzed: dassetvā dassetvā dhammaṃ desesi tam sutvā sabbe arahatta phale patiṭṭhahiṃsu atha
translated: having shown them a miracle, taught them the Dhamma. Having heard it, they were all established in the fruit of arahantship. Then

original: dvepi mahānāgā pañca bhikkhusatāni gahetvā vehāsaṃ abbhuggantvā veḷuvanamevāgamiṃsu.
analyzed: dve api mahā nāgā pañca bhikkhu satāni gahetvā vehāsam abbhut gantvā veḷuvanam eva āgamiṃsu
translated: the two great elders, taking the five hundred monks, rose up into the air and returned to the Bamboo Grove.

original: Anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṃ pana buddhānaṃ satataṃ dhammadesanā, tesu iddhipāṭihāriyaādesanāpāṭihāriyāni
analyzed: anusāsanī pāṭihāriyam pana buddhānam satatam dhamma desanā tesu iddhi pāṭihāriya ādesanā pāṭihāriyāni
translated: But the miracle of instruction is the Buddhas’ constant teaching of the Dhamma. Of these, the miracle of supernormal power, the miracle of mind-reading,

original: saupārambhāni sadosāni, addhānaṃ na tiṭṭhanti, addhānaṃ atiṭṭhanato na niyyanti.
analyzed: sa aupārambhāni sa dosāni addhānam na tiṭṭhanti addhānam a tiṭṭhanataḥ na niyyanti
translated: and the miracle of instruction are accompanied by conflict, are accompanied by corruption, do not last, and do not endure.

original: Anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṃ anupārambhaṃ niddosaṃ, addhānaṃ tiṭṭhati, addhānaṃ tiṭṭhanato
analyzed: anusāsanī pāṭihāriyam an upārambham niddosam addhānam tiṭṭhati addhānam tiṭṭhanataḥ
translated: The miracle of mind-reading is not a reproach, is without hate, and it lasts as long as the round of existence. Because it lasts as long as the round of existence,

original: niyyāti. Tasmā bhagavā iddhipāṭihāriyañca ādesanāpāṭihāriyañca garahati, anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṃyeva pasaṃsati.
analyzed: niyyāti tasmai bhagavā iddhi pāṭihāriyam ca ādesanā pāṭihāriyam ca garahati anusāsanī pāṭihāriyaṃyā iva pasaṃsati
translated: the Blessed One censures the miracle of supernormal power and the miracle of telepathy and commends the miracle of mind-reading.

original: Bhūtanirodhesakavatthuvaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Section on the Cessation of Essences

original: 487. Bhūtapubbanti idaṃ kasmā bhagavatā āraddhaṃ. Iddhipāṭihāriyaādesanāpāṭihāriyānaṃ
analyzed: bhūta pubbam ti idam kasmai bhagavatā āraddham iddhi pāṭihāriya ādesanā pāṭihāriyānam
translated: Why did the Blessed One begin with the words “It was said” ?

original: aniyyānikabhāvadassanatthaṃ, anusāsanīpāṭihāriyasseva niyyānikabhāvadassanatthaṃ.
analyzed: a niyyānika bhāva dassana tham anusāsanī pāṭihāriyassa iva niyyānika bhāva dassana tham
translated: In order to show that the miracle of supernormal power and the miracle of telepathy are not emancipating, and in order to show that only the miracle of mind-reading is emancipating.

original: Api ca sabbabuddhānaṃ mahābhūtapariyesako nāmeko bhikkhu hotiyeva. Yo mahābhūte pariyesanto
analyzed: api ca sabba buddhānam mahābhūta pariyesakaḥ nāma ekaḥ bhikkhu yaḥ mahābhūte pariyesantaḥ
translated: Moreover, there is always one bhikkhu among all the Buddhas who is a seeker after the great essentials .

original: yāva brahmalokā vicaritvā vissajjetāraṃ alabhitvā āgamma buddhameva pucchitvā nikkaṅkho
analyzed: yāva brahma lokāḥ vicaritvā vissajjetāram a labhitvā āgamma buddham eva pucchitvā nikkaṅkhaḥ
translated: Having searched for the great essentials, he goes about seeking a declarer until he comes to the Buddha and is satisfied.

original: hoti. Tasmā buddhānaṃ mahantabhāvappakāsanatthaṃ, idañca kāraṇaṃ paṭicchannaṃ, atha
analyzed: hoti tasmai buddhānam mahanta bhāva ppakāsana attham idam ca kāraṇam paṭicchannam atha
translated: Therefore, in order to show the greatness of the Buddhas, this reason is concealed, and

original: naṃ vivaṭaṃ katvā desentopi bhagavā “bhūtapubba”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: nam vivaṭam katvā desentaḥ api bhagavā bhūta pubba nti ādim āha
translated: The Blessed One, in explaining it, said, “It was once said” .

original: Tattha kattha nu khoti kismiṃ ṭhāne kiṃ āgamma kiṃ pattassa te anavasesā appavattivasena
analyzed: tattha kattha nu kho ti kismin ṭhāne kim āgamma kim pattassa te anavasesāḥ appavatti vasena
translated: Herein, where? In what place? Having come to what, having attained what, do they cease without remainder, without exception?

original: nirujjhanti. Mahābhūtakathā panesā sabbākārena visuddhimagge vuttā, tasmā sā tatova gahetabbā.
analyzed: nirujjhanti mahābhūta kathā pana isā sabba ākārena visuddhi magge vuttā tasmā sā tatas va gahetabbā
translated: This discussion of the primary elements is given in the Visuddhimagga in all its details, so it should be taken from there.

original: 488. Devayāniyo maggoti pāṭiyekko devalokagamanamaggo nāma natthi, iddhividhañāṇasseva
analyzed: devayāniyaḥ maggo ti pāṭiyekkaḥ deva loka gamana maggaḥ nāma natthi iddhividha ñāṇassa iva
translated: The way to the gods: there is no separate way to the world of the gods called “the way to the gods.” It is a term for the knowledge of the kinds of supernormal power.

original: panetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Tena hesa yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vattento devalokaṃ🔽yāti. Tasmā “taṃ devayāniyo maggo”ti vuttaṃ. Yena cātumahārājikāti samīpe ṭhitampi
analyzed: adhivacanam tena ha isa kāyena vasam vattentaḥ deva lokam  yāti tasmā tam devayāniyaḥ maggo ti vuttam yena cātumahārājikā ati samīpe ṭhitam pi
translated: Therefore, by exercising mastery with his body as far as the Brahmā-world, he goes to the world of the gods.🔽That is why it is said, “the way to the gods.”

original: bhagavantaṃ apucchitvā dhammatāya codito devatā mahānubhāvāti maññamāno upasaṅkami.
analyzed: bhagavantam a pucchitvā dhammatāya coditaḥ devatā mahā anubhāvā iti maññamānaḥ upasaṅkami
translated: The four great kings: without asking the Blessed One who was standing nearby, the deity approached him, thinking that deities of great power are entitled to be abrupt.

original: Mayampi kho, bhikkhu, na jānāmāti buddhavisaye pañhaṃ pucchitā devatā na jānanti,
analyzed: mayam pi kho bhikkhu na jānāma ati buddha visaye pañham pucchitāḥ devatāḥ na jānanti
translated: We do not know, bhikkhu: deities do not know an answer to a question that falls within the domain of Buddhas.

original: tenevamāhaṃsu. Atha kho so bhikkhu “mama imaṃ pañhaṃ na kathetuṃ na labbhā, sīghaṃ🔽kathethā”ti tā devatā ajjhottharati, punappunaṃ pucchati, tā “ajjhottharati no ayaṃ
analyzed: tena ivam āhaṃsu atha kho so bhikkhu mama imam pañham na kathetum na labbhā sīgham  kathetha iti tāḥ devatāḥ ajjhottharati punappunam pucchati tāḥ ajjhottharati na u ayam
translated: So they said this. Then the monk, thinking “I am not allowed not to answer this question,

translated: “He is wandering about asking questions. I will send him to the Teacher.” Then he thought again, “Even if he goes a long way, he will be free from doubt in the presence of the Teacher. And there is such a person. Let him wander about a little, and he will get tired. Later he will know.” Then he said to him, “I too,” etc. Brahmayāniya is similar to Devayāniya. Devayāniyamagga, Brahmayāniyamagga, Dhammasetubandha, one-moment-only-apprehension, decisive-intention, exalted consciousness, and direct-knowledge-knowledge are all names for the knowledge of the kinds of supernormal power.

original: vimocetu, taṃ diṭṭhigataṃ vinodetūti vadati. Ayaṃ kira upāsako lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa
analyzed: vimocetu tam diṭṭhi gatam vinodetu uti vadati ayam kira upāsakaḥ lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa
translated: to explain, to remove that view. This lay follower was a dear friend of the brahmin Lohicca.

original: piyasahāyako. Tasmā tassa atthakāmatāya evamāha. Appeva nāma siyāti ettha paṭhamavacanena
analyzed: piya sahāyakaḥ tasmā tassa attha kāma tāya evam āha appa iva nāma siyā ti ettha paṭhama vacanena
translated: Therefore, out of concern for his welfare, he said this. “Perhaps” : here the first

original: bhagavā gajjati, dutiyavacanena anugajjati. Ayaṃ kirettha adhippāyo – rosike etadatthameva🔽mayā cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni. Kappasatasahassañca vividhāni dukkarāni karontena pāramiyo🔽pūritā, etadatthameva sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ paṭividdhaṃ, na me lohiccassa diṭṭhigataṃ
analyzed: bhagavā gajjati dutiya vacanena anugajjati ayam kira itthā adhippāyaḥ rosike etad attham eva  mayā cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni kappa sata sahassam ca vividhāni dukkarāni karontena pāramiyaḥ  pūritā etad attham eva sabbaññuta ññāṇam paṭividdham na me lohiccassa diṭṭhi gatam
translated: “perhaps” is the Blessed One’s roar, and the second “perhaps” is his counter-roar. The meaning is this: “For the sake of this very thing, O Rosika,

original: bhindituṃ bhāroti, imamatthaṃ dassento paṭhamavacanena bhagavā gajjati. Kevalaṃ rosike
analyzed: bhinditum bhāro ti imam attham dassento paṭhama vacanena bhagavā gajjati kevalam rosike
translated: I fulfilled the perfections by undergoing austerities for a hundred thousand aeons and four incalculable ages. For the sake of this very thing, I penetrated the knowledge of omniscience. I am not able to break down Lohicca’s view.” Showing this meaning, the Blessed One roars with the first “perhaps.” “Only, Rosika,

original: lohiccassa mama santike āgamanaṃ vā nisajjā vā allāpasallāpo vā hotu, sacepi lohiccasadisānaṃ
analyzed: lohiccassa mama santike āgamanam vā nisajjā vā allāpa sallāpaḥ vā hotu sace pi lohicca sadisānam
translated: Or let there be coming to me, sitting with me, and conversation with me, or let there be a hundred thousand like Lohicca,

original: satasahassassa kaṅkhā hoti, paṭibalo ahaṃ vinodetuṃ lohiccassa pana ekassa diṭṭhivinodane
analyzed: sata sahassassa kaṅkhā hoti paṭibalaḥ aham vinodetum lohiccassa pana ekassa diṭṭhi vinodane
translated: I am able to dispel the doubt of a hundred thousand like Lohicca, but as to dispelling the view of one Lohicca,

original: mayhaṃ ko bhāroti imamatthaṃ dassento dutiyavacanena bhagavā anugajjatīti veditabbo.
analyzed: mayham kaḥ bhāro ti imam attham dassentaḥ dutiya vacanena bhagavā anugajjati iti veditabbaḥ
translated: what is the use to me?” The Blessed One is to be understood as reproaching himself with the second statement, showing the meaning of this:

original: Lohiccabrāhmaṇānuyogavaṇṇanā
analyzed: lohicca brāhmaṇa anuyoga vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Pursuit of Lohicca the brahman.

original: 509. Samudayasañjātīti samudayassa sañjāti bhoguppādo, tato uṭṭhitaṃ dhanadhaññanti
analyzed: samudaya sañjāti iti samudayassa sañjāti bhoga uppādo tatas uṭṭhitam dhana dhaññanti
translated: “Arisen from the source”: arisen from the source of gain, the arising of gain, the appearance of gain, is what is meant.

original: attho. Ye taṃ upajīvantīti ye ñātiparijanadāsakammakarādayo janā taṃ nissāya jīvanti.🔽Antarāyakaroti lābhantarāyakaro. Hitānukampīti ettha hitanti vuḍḍhi. Anukampatīti
analyzed: atthaḥ ye tam upajīvanti iti ye ñāti parijana dāsa kammakara ādayaḥ janā tam nissāya jīvanti  antarāya karoti lābha antarāya karaḥ hita anukampī iti ettha anukampati iti
translated: “Those who live on it”: those people who live depending on it, such as relatives, servants, workmen, and so on.🔽“An obstacle”: an obstacle to gain.

original: anukampī, icchatīti attho, vuḍḍhiṃ icchati vā no vāti vuttaṃ hoti. Nirayaṃ vā tiracchānayoniṃ
analyzed: anukampī icchati iti atthaḥ vuḍḍhim icchati vā no vā ati vuttam hoti nirayam vā tiracchānayonim
translated: “Sympathetic”: here, “sympathetic” is “sympathy” . “Sympathetic” is what is meant by “sympathizes” . “Wants” is what is meant. What is meant is: “He wants increase or not.”🔽“To hell or to the animal womb” .

original: vāti sace sā micchādiṭṭhi sampajjati, niyatā hoti, ekaṃsena niraye nibbattati, no
analyzed: vāti sace sā micchādiṭṭhi sampajjati niyatā hoti ekaṃsena niraye nibbattati no
translated: If that wrong view succeeds, it is certain that he will be reborn in hell,

original: ce, tiracchānayoniyaṃ nibbattatīti attho.
analyzed: ce tiracchānayoniyam nibbattati iti attho
translated: and if not, then in the animal realm.

original: 510-512. Idāni yasmā yathā attano lābhantarāyena sattā saṃvijjanti na tathā paresaṃ,
analyzed: idāni yasmai yathā saṃvijjanti na tathā paresam
translated: Now, since beings are not so much hindered in their own gain as in that of others,

original: tasmā suṭṭhutaraṃ brāhmaṇaṃ pavecetukāmo “taṃ kiṃ maññasī”ti dutiyaṃ upapattimāha.
analyzed: tasmā suṭṭhutaram brāhmaṇam pavecetu kāmo tam kim maññasi iti dutiyam upapattim āha
translated: he asks a second question, “What do you think, Brahmin?,” wishing to make the Brahmin understand even more clearly.

original: Ye cimeti ye ca ime tathāgatassa dhammadesanaṃ sutvā ariyabhūmiṃ okkamituṃ asakkontā
analyzed: ye cimā iti ye ca ime tathāgatassa dhamma desanam sutvā ariya bhūmim okkamitum a sakkontā
translated: “Those who, not being able to enter the noble plane after hearing the Tathagata’s teaching of the Dhamma,

original: kulaputtā dibbā gabbhāti upayogatthe paccattavacanaṃ, dibbe gabbheti attho. Dibbā,
analyzed: kula puttāḥ dibbāḥ gabbhā ti upayoga atthe paccatta vacanam dibbe gabbhā iti atthaḥ dibbā
translated: “Divine wombs”: the word “womb” is used in the sense of “enjoyment.” The meaning is: divine enjoyments.🔽“Divine wombs” is a designation for the six divine worlds.

original: gabbhāti ca channaṃ devalokānametaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Paripācentīti devalokagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ
analyzed: ca channam deva lokānam etam adhivacanam paripācenti iti deva loka gāminim paṭipadam
translated: “They develop” : they fulfill the practice leading to the divine worlds.

original: pūrayamānā dānaṃ, dadamānā, sīlaṃ rakkhamānā, gandhamālādīhi, pūjaṃ kurumānā bhāvanaṃ
analyzed: pūrayamānā dānam dadamānā sīlam rakkhamānā gandha mālā ādīhi pūjam kurumānā bhāvanam
translated: “They give gifts, they guard morality, they worship the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha” .

original: bhāvayamānā pācenti vipācenti paripācenti pariṇāmaṃ gamenti. Dibbānaṃ bhavānaṃ abhinibbattiyāti
analyzed: bhāvayamānā pācenti vipācenti paripācenti pariṇāmam gamenti dibbānam bhavānam abhinibbattiyā ati
translated: They cause them to be born, to be produced, to be generated, to come into being. For the production of heavenly existences:

original: dibbabhavā nāma devānaṃ vimānāni, tesaṃ nibbattanatthāyāti attho. Atha vā dibbā gabbhāti🔽dānādayo puññavisesā. Dibbā bhavāti devaloke vipākakkhandhā, tesaṃ nibbattanatthāya
analyzed: dibbabhavāḥ nāma devānam vimānāni tesam nibbattana atthāya ati atthaḥ atha vā dibbā gabbhā ati  dāna ādayo puñña visesāḥ dibbāḥ deva loke vipāka kkhandhāḥ tesam nibbattana tthāya
translated: Heavenly existences are the divine mansions of the gods. The meaning is: for the purpose of their production. Or alternatively, heavenly wombs:

original: tāni puññāni karontīti attho. Tesaṃ antarāyakaroti tesaṃ maggasampattiphalasampattidibbabhavavisesānaṃ🔽antarāyakaro. Iti bhagavā ettāvatā aniyamiteneva opammavidhinā yāva bhavaggā uggataṃ
analyzed: tāni puññāni karonti iti attho tesam antarāya karoti tesam magga sampatti phala sampatti dibba bhava visesānam  antarāya karaḥ iti bhagavā ettāvatā aniyamitena iva opamma vidhinā yāva bhavaggāḥ uggatam
translated: are the special kinds of merit such as giving, etc. Heavenly existences: are the aggregates of existence in the deva world that are the result of that merit. The meaning is: they do the meritorious deeds for the purpose of their production. An obstacle to them: an obstacle to the excellence of the path, the excellence of the fruition, and the excellence of the heavenly existences.

original: brāhmaṇassa mānaṃ bhinditvā idāni codanārahe tayo satthāre dassetuṃ “tayo kho me, lohiccā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: brāhmaṇassa mānam bhinditvā idāni codanā rahe tayo satthāre dassetum tayo kho me lohitacca iti ādim āha
translated: Thus the Blessed One, having broken the brahmin’s pride that had risen up to the highest existence with an unfixed simile, now said, “Three things, Lohicca,” in order to show the three teachers who are worthy of censure.

original: Tayo codanārahavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tayo codanā raha vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the three worthy of censure

original: 513. Tattha sā codanāti tayo satthāre codentassa codanā. Na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapentīti
analyzed: tattha sā codanā ati tayo satthāre codentassa codanā na aññā cittam upaṭṭhapenti iti
translated: . Herein, the censure: the censure of one who censures the three teachers. Do not attend to the mind:

original: aññāya ājānanatthāya cittaṃ na upaṭṭhapenti. Vokkammāti nirantaraṃ tassa sāsanaṃ🔽akatvā tato ukkamitvā vattantīti attho. Osakkantiyā vā ussakkeyyāti paṭikkamantiyā🔽upagaccheyya, anicchantiyā iccheyya, ekāya sampayogaṃ anicchantiyā eko iccheyyāti🔽vuttaṃ hoti. Parammukhiṃ vā āliṅgeyyāti daṭṭhumpi anicchamānaṃ parammukhiṃ ṭhitaṃ
analyzed: aññāya ājānana tthāya cittam na upaṭṭhapenti vokkamma ati nirantaram tassa sāsanam  a katvā tatas ukkamitvā vattanti iti attho osakkantiyā vā ussakkeyya ati paṭikkamantiyā  upagaccheyya an icchantiyāḥ iccheyya ekāya sampayogam an icchantiyāḥ ekaḥ iccheyya ati  vuttam hoti parammukhim vā āliṅgeyya ati daṭṭhum pi an icchamānam parammukhim ṭhitam
translated: They do not set their minds on understanding and knowing. They transgress: without making a continuous effort at his teaching, they go beyond it and act otherwise. Or else, “they would go to meet her” means they would go to meet her when she was coming back.🔽If she does not want it, he wants it; if one does not want union with him, he wants it.🔽Or else, “he would embrace her in front” means that he would embrace one who does not want to see him, who is standing with her face averted.

original: pacchato gantvā āliṅgeyya. Evaṃsampadamidanti imassāpi satthuno “mama ime sāvakā”ti🔽sāsanā vokkamma vattamānepi te lobhena anusāsato imaṃ lobhadhammaṃ evaṃsampadameva🔽īdisameva vadāmi. Iti so evarūpo tava lobhadhammo yena tvaṃ osakkantiyā ussakkanto🔽viya parammukhiṃ āliṅganto viya ahosītipi taṃ codanaṃ arahati. Kiñhi paro parassa
analyzed: pacchatas gantvā āliṅgeyya evaṃsampadam idam ti imassa api satthunaḥ mama ime sāvakā ati 🔽sāsanā vokkamma vattamāne pi te lobhena anusāsataḥ imam lobha dhammam evaṃsampadam eva 🔽īdisam eva vadāmi iti saḥ evarūpaḥ tava lobha dhammo yena tvam osakkantiyā ussakkantaḥ 🔽viya parammukhim āliṅgantaḥ viya tam codanam arahati kim hi paraḥ parassa
translated: They do not set their minds on understanding and knowing. They go beyond the Teacher’s Dispensation: they do not act in accordance with it without interruption. They go beyond it, is the meaning. Or else, if they are going away, he would go after them: if they are going away, he would go after them. If one does not want union with one, one would want it: if one does not want union with one, one would want it. He would embrace one who is facing away from him: if one does not want to see him, he would embrace one who is standing facing away from him. Having gone behind him, he would embrace him. This is the way it is with this: this is what I say about this teacher, too, who, though his disciples go beyond his Dispensation and act in opposition to it, still teaches them out of greed. This is the way it is with this, with this very same state of greed. This is the way it is with this, with this very same state of greed. Thus this state of greed in you is worthy of rebuke in that you, like one who goes after those who are going away, like one who embraces one who is facing away from him, have become . What can the other do for the other?

original: karissatīti yena dhammena pare anusāsi, attānameva tāva tattha sampādehi, ujuṃ karohi.
analyzed: karissati iti yena dhammena pare anusāsi attānam eva tāva tattha sampādehi ujum karohi
translated: “What can another do for another?” He should make himself fit for the teaching by which he teaches others, he should make himself straight.

original: Kiñhi paro parassa karissatīti codanaṃ arahati.
analyzed: kim hi paraḥ parassa karissati iti codanam arahati
translated: For what can one person do for another?

original: 514. Niddāyitabbanti sassarūpakāni tiṇāni uppāṭetvā parisuddhaṃ kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: niddāyitabbanti sa sarūpakāni tiṇāni uppāṭetvā parisuddham kātabbam
translated: “Should be swept out”: the grass and so on should be removed and the place should be cleaned up.

original: 515. Tatiyacodanāya kiñhi paro parassāti anusāsanaṃ asampaṭicchanakālato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: tatiya codanāya kiñhi paraḥ parassa ati anusāsanam a sampaṭicchana kālataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: “What can another do for another?” means that after the refusal to accept the advice,

original: paro anusāsitabbo, parassa anusāsakassa kiṃ karissatīti nanu tattha appossukkataṃ
analyzed: paraḥ anusāsitabbo parassa anusāsakassa kim karissati iti nanu tattha appossukkatam
translated: the other person should be taught. What can the other person, the teacher, do for the other person, the pupil?🔽Therefore, without taking any interest in that,

original: āpajjitvā attanā paṭividdhadhammaṃ attanāva mānetvā pūjetvā vihātabbanti evaṃ codanaṃ arahatīti attho.
analyzed: āpajjitvā attanā paṭividdha dhammam attanā ava mānetvā pūjetvā vihātabbanti evam codanam arahati iti atthaḥ
translated: he should honour and respect the Dhamma he has himself penetrated and live accordingly. This is the meaning of “he deserves reproof.”

original: Na codanārahasatthuvaṇṇanā
analyzed: na codanā raha satthu vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the teacher who does not deserve reproof

original: 516. Na codanārahoti ayañhi yasmā paṭhamameva attānaṃ patirūpe patiṭṭhāpetvā sāvakānaṃ
analyzed: na codanā rahā uti ayan hi yasmai paṭhamam eva attānam patirūpe patiṭṭhāpetvā sāvakānam
translated: “Does not deserve reproof”: since he first makes himself fit and then teaches the Dhamma to his disciples,🔽and since his disciples listen and practice according to the teaching,

original: dhammaṃ deseti. Sāvakā cassa assavā hutvā yathānusiṭṭhaṃ paṭipajjanti, tāya ca paṭipattiyā
analyzed: dhammam deseti sāvakā ca assa assavāḥ hutvā yathānusiṭṭham paṭipajjanti tāya ca paṭipattiyā
translated: and since they attain the fruits of the practice,

original: mahantaṃ visesamadhigacchanti. Tasmā na codanārahoti.
analyzed: mahantam visesam adhigacchanti tasmai na codanā rahāḥ iti
translated: they attain a great distinction. That is why he is not worthy of censure.

original: 517. Narakapapātaṃ papatantoti mayā gahitāya diṭṭhiyā ahaṃ narakapapātaṃ papatanto.🔽Uddharitvā thale patiṭṭhāpitoti taṃ diṭṭhiṃ bhinditvā dhammadesanāhatthena apāyapatanato
analyzed: naraka papātam papatanto ti mayā gahitāya diṭṭhiyā aham naraka papātam papatanto  uddharitvā thale patiṭṭhāpito ti tam diṭṭhim bhinditvā dhamma desanā hatthena apāya patanato
translated: Falling into the hell-abyss: I was falling into the hell-abyss through the view I had taken.

original: uddharitvā saggamaggathale ṭhapitomhīti vadati. Sesamettha uttānamevāti.
analyzed: uddharitvā sagga magga thale ṭhapitaḥ ahi iti vadati sesam ettha uttānam eva ati
translated: I pulled him out and set him on firm ground: I broke his view and by the hand of the Dhamma teaching I pulled him out of falling into the states of loss and set him on the firm ground of the path to heaven. The rest is clear.

original: Iti sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: iti sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīgha nikāya ṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: So in the Dīghanikāya Commentary on the Sumaṅgala-vilāsinī

original: Lohiccasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: lohicca sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: the Commentary on the Lohicca Sutta is finished.

original: 13. Tevijjasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tevijja sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Tevijja Sutta

original: 518. Evaṃ me sutaṃ…pe… kosalesūti tevijjasuttaṃ. Tatrāyaṃ anuttānapadavaṇṇanā. Manasākaṭanti
analyzed: evam me sutaṃpe tevijja suttam tatra ayam anuttāna pada vaṇṇanā
translated: Thus have I heard … in the Kosala country: the Tevijja Sutta. Here is a commentary on the untransliterated passages. Manasakata is

original: tassa gāmassa nāmaṃ. Uttarena manasākaṭassāti manasākaṭato avidūre uttarapasse. Ambavaneti
analyzed: tassa gāmassa nāmam uttarena manasākaṭassa ati manasākaṭataḥ avidūre uttara passe ambavanā iti
translated: the name of a village. To the north of Manasakata: not far from Manasakata, on the northern side. In a mango grove:

original: taruṇaambarukkhasaṇḍe, ramaṇīyo kira so bhūmibhāgo, heṭṭhā rajatapaṭṭasadisā vālikā
analyzed: ramaṇīyaḥ kira saḥ bhūmi bhāgaḥ heṭṭhā rajata paṭṭa sadisā vālikā
translated: in a thicket of young mango trees. The place was delightful, it seems, and the sand below was like a silver plate.

original: vippakiṇṇā, upari maṇivitānaṃ viya ghanasākhāpattaṃ ambavanaṃ. Tasmiṃ buddhānaṃ anucchavike
analyzed: vippakiṇṇāḥ upari maṇi vitānam viya ghana sākhā pattam ambavanam tasmin buddhānam anucchavike
translated: It was a grove of mango trees with dense branches and foliage, like a canopy of gems spread out above.

original: pavivekasukhe ambavane viharatīti attho.
analyzed: pa viveka sukhe ambavane viharati iti attho
translated: The meaning is that he was living in that mango grove, which was suitable for Buddhas and which was a place of happiness in solitude.

original: 519. Abhiññātā abhiññātāti kulacārittādisampattiyā tattha tattha paññātā. Caṅkītiādīni
analyzed: abhiññātā abhiññātā ati kula cāritta ādi sampattiyā tattha tattha paññātā caṅkī itiādīni
translated: Renowned, renowned: they were renowned here and there because of their perfection of family, conduct, and so on. Caṅkī, etc.,

original: tesaṃ nāmāni. Tattha caṅkī opāsādavāsiko. Tārukkho icchānaṅgalavāsiko. Pokkharasātī
analyzed: tesam nāmāni tattha caṅkī opāsāda vāsiko tārukkho icchānaṅgala vāsiko pokkharasātī
translated: are their names. Herein, Caṅkī lived in Opāsāda, Tārukkha lived in Icchānaṅgala, Pokkharasāti

original: ukkaṭṭhavāsiko. Jāṇusoṇī sāvatthivāsiko. Todeyyo tudigāmavāsiko. Aññe cāti aññe ca
analyzed: ukkaṭṭha vāsikaḥ jāṇusoṇī sāvatthi vāsiko todeyyo tudigāma vāsiko aññe ca ati aññe ca
translated: lived in Ukkattha, Jāṇussoṇi lived in Sāvatthī, Todeyya lived in Tudigāma, and the others

original: bahujanā. Attano attano nivāsaṭṭhānehi āgantvā mantasajjhāyakaraṇatthaṃ tattha paṭivasanti.
analyzed: bahu janāḥ attanaḥ attanaḥ nivāsa ṭṭhānehi āgantvā manta sajjhāya karaṇa ttham tattha paṭivasanti
translated: were many people who, having come from their own places of residence, were living there in order to prepare the discussion.

original: Manasākaṭassa kira ramaṇīyatāya te brāhmaṇā tattha nadītīre gehāni kāretvā parikkhipāpetvā
analyzed: manasākaṭassa kira ramaṇīya tāya te brāhmaṇā tattha nadī tīre gehāni kāretvā parikkhipāpetvā
translated: It seems that because Manasākaṭa was delightful, those brahmins had houses built on the bank of the river there, had them surrounded,

original: aññesaṃ bahūnaṃ pavesanaṃ nivāretvā antarantarā tattha gantvā vasanti.
analyzed: aññesam bahūnam pavesanam nivāretvā antarantarā tattha gantvā vasanti
translated: and having prevented others from entering, they went there and lived from time to time.

original: 520-521. Vāseṭṭhabhāradvājānanti vāseṭṭhassa ca pokkharasātino antevāsikassa, bhāradvājassa

analyzed: atthi me accāyika kammanti attho
translated: He might say, “Come, ferryman, ferry me across to the other side.” The meaning is, “If you suddenly seize me and take me across, I have important business to attend to.”

original: 544. Ye dhammā brāhmaṇakārakāti ettha pañcasīladasakusalakammapathabhedā dhammā brāhmaṇakārakāti
analyzed: ye dhammā brāhmaṇa kārakā ati ettha pañca sīla dasa kusala kammapatha bhedāḥ dhammāḥ brāhmaṇa kārakā ati
translated: . The words “the things that make a brahmin” refer to the five precepts and the ten kinds of profitable action.

original: veditabbā, tabbiparītā abrāhmaṇakārakā. Indamavhāyāmāti indaṃ avhāyāma pakkosāma.
analyzed: veditabbā tad biparītāḥ a brāhmaṇa kārakāḥ indam avhāyāma ati indam avhāyāma pakkosāma
translated: These should be understood as the things that make a brahmin; the opposite of these are the things that do not make a brahmin. “We will summon Indra” means we will summon him, we will invite him.

original: Evaṃ brāhmaṇānaṃ avhāyanassa niratthakataṃ dassetvā punapi bhagavā aṇṇavakucchiyaṃ
analyzed: evam brāhmaṇānam avhāyanassa niratthaka tam dassetvā puna api bhagavā aṇṇavakucchiyam
translated: Having thus shown the futility of the brahmins’ invocation, the Blessed One, blazing like the sun in the waters of the Anavatatta,

original: sūriyo viya jalamāno pañcasatabhikkhuparivuto aciravatiyā tīre nisinno aparampi nadīupamaṃyeva
analyzed: sūriyaḥ viya jalamānaḥ pañca sata bhikkhu parivutaḥ aciravatiyā tīre nisinno aparam pi nadī upamaṃyā iva
translated: seated on the bank of the river Aciravatī surrounded by five hundred bhikkhus, again brought up the simile of the river,

original: āharanto “seyyathāpī”tiādimāha.🔽546. Kāmaguṇāti kāmayitabbaṭṭhena kāmā, bandhanaṭṭhena guṇā. “Anujānāmi bhikkhave,
analyzed: sā iyyathā api iti ādim āha  kāma guṇā ti kāmayitabba ṭṭhena kāmāḥ bandhana ṭṭhena guṇāḥ anujānāmi bhikkhave
translated: saying “Suppose” .🔽The words “the strands of sensual desire” are analyzed as follows: they are sensual desires in the sense of what is desirable , and strands in the sense of bonds .

original: ahatānaṃ vatthānaṃ diguṇaṃ saṅghāṭi”nti ettha hi paṭalaṭṭho guṇaṭṭho. “Accenti kālā
analyzed: ahatānam vatthānam diguṇam ettha hi paṭala ṭhaḥ guṇa ṭhaḥ
translated: For in the passage “Bhikkhus, I allow a double-layered outer robe made of new cloth” the word “layered” has the sense of a fold .🔽“The seasons pass” .

original: tarayanti rattiyo, vayoguṇā anupubbaṃ jahantī”ti ettha rāsaṭṭho guṇaṭṭho. “Sataguṇā🔽dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā”ti ettha ānisaṃsaṭṭho guṇaṭṭho. “Antaṃ antaguṇaṃ kayirā🔽mālāguṇe bahū”ti ca ettha bandhanaṭṭho guṇaṭṭho. Idhāpi eseva adhippeto. Tena vuttaṃ
analyzed: tarayanti rattiyaḥ vayaḥ guṇāḥ anupubbam jahanti iti ettha rāsaṭṭhaḥ guṇaṭṭhaḥ sataguṇā  dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā ti ettha ānisaṃsa ṭhaḥ guṇa ṭhaḥ antam anta guṇam kayirā  mālā guṇe bahū ti ca ettha bandhana ṭṭhaḥ guṇa ṭṭhaḥ idha api esā iva adhippeto tena vuttam
translated: and the nights carry him away, and his life-span diminishes gradually. ” Here the meaning of “string” is the meaning of “quality.” “A hundredfold🔽reward is to be expected” . Here the meaning of “string” is the meaning of “advantage.” “He should make an inner string,🔽many strings of flowers” . Here the meaning of “string” is the meaning of “bond.” The same meaning is intended here. Hence it was said:

original: “bandhanaṭṭhena guṇā”ti. Cakkhuviññeyyāti cakkhuviññāṇena passitabbā. Etenupāyena
analyzed: bandhana ṭṭhena guṇā ati cakkhu viññeyyā ati cakkhu viññāṇena passitabbā etena upāyena
translated: and nights carry one away, and the qualities of youth are gradually lost. ” Here the meaning is that of a string. “A hundredfold reward is to be expected” . Here the meaning is that of an advantage. “He should make an end and a string of flowers” . Here the meaning is that of a binding. And here too that is intended. Hence it was said above “in the sense of a binding” . To be seen with the eye : to be seen with eye-consciousness. In the same way with the ear, etc.

original: sotaviññeyyādīsupi attho veditabbo. Iṭṭhāti pariyiṭṭhā vā hontu, mā vā, iṭṭhārammaṇabhūtāti🔽attho. Kantāti kāmanīyā. Manāpāti manavaḍḍhanakā. Piyarūpāti piyajātikā. Kāmūpasañhitāti
analyzed: sota viññeyya ādīsu pi atthaḥ veditabbaḥ iṭṭhā ati pariyiṭṭhāḥ vā hontu mā vā iṭṭha ārammaṇa bhūtā ati  attho kantā ati kāmanīyā manāpā ati mana vaḍḍhanakā piya rūpā ati piya jātikā kāmūpasañhitā ati
translated: Pleasant : either to be desired or not to be desired. The meaning is that they are objects that are desired.

original: ārammaṇaṃ katvā uppajjamānena kāmena upasañhitā. Rajanīyāti rañjanīyā, rāguppattikāraṇabhūtāti attho.
analyzed: ārammaṇam katvā uppajjamānena kāmena upasañhitā rajanīyā ati rañjanīyā rāga uppatti kāraṇa bhūtā ati attho
translated: Lovely : desirable. Agreeable : enhancing the mind. Dear : of a kind to be dear. Associated with relishing : associated with lust that arises making them its object. Delightful : delightful, a cause for the arising of lust, is the meaning.

original: Gadhitāti gedhena abhibhūtā hutvā. Mucchitāti mucchākārappattāya adhimattakāya taṇhāya
analyzed: gadhitā ati gedhena abhibhūtā hutvā mucchitā ati mucchākāra ppattāya adhimattakāya taṇhāya
translated: “Addicted” means overcome by attachment. “Obsessed” means overcome by strong craving that has reached the state of obsession.

original: abhibhūtā. Ajjhopannāti adhiopannā ogāḷhā “idaṃ sāra”nti pariniṭṭhānappattā hutvā.
analyzed: abhibhūtā ajjhopannā ati adhiopannā ogāḷhā idam sāranti pariniṭṭhāna ppattā hutvā
translated: “Engrossed” means engrossed, immersed, having reached the state of final conclusion, thinking “This is the essence.”

original: Anādīnavadassāvinoti ādīnavaṃ apassantā. Anissaraṇapaññāti idamettha nissaraṇanti,
analyzed: anādīnava dassāvino ti ādīnavam a passantā a nissaraṇa paññā ati idam ettha nissaraṇanti
translated: “Not seeing the danger” means not seeing the danger. “Lacking the wisdom of escape” means lacking the wisdom of fully understanding this is the escape from it.

original: evaṃ parijānanapaññāvirahitā, paccavekkhaṇaparibhogavirahitāti attho.
analyzed: evam parijānana paññā virahitā paccavekkhaṇa paribhoga virahitā ti attho
translated: The meaning is: lacking the wisdom of reviewing and enjoying.

original: 548. Āvaraṇātiādīsu āvarantīti āvaraṇā. Nivārentīti nīvaraṇā. Onandhantīti onāhanā. Pariyonandhantīti pariyonāhanā. Kāmacchandādīnaṃ vitthārakathā visuddhimaggato gahetabbā.
analyzed: āvaraṇā ati ādīsu āvaranti iti āvaraṇāḥ nivārenti iti nīvaraṇāḥ onandhanti iti onāhanā pariyonandhanti iti pariyonāhanā kāmacchanda ādīnam vitthāra kathā visuddhi maggataḥ gahetabbā
translated: As to “hindrance” and so on: they obstruct, thus they are hindrances. They prevent, thus they are obstructions. They delight, thus they are deceptions. They deceive thoroughly, thus they are infatuations. The detailed explanation of sensual desire, etc., should be understood according to the Path of Purification.

original: 549-550. Āvutā nivutā onaddhā pariyonaddhāti padāni āvaraṇādīnaṃ vasena vuttāni.
analyzed: āvutā nivutā onaddhā pariyonaddhā iti padāni āvaraṇa ādīnam vasena vuttāni
translated: “Covered, enveloped, and shrouded” are said with reference to the hindrances, etc.

original: Sapariggahoti itthipariggahena sapariggahoti pucchati. Apariggaho bho gotamātiādīsupi
analyzed: sa pariggaho ti itthi pariggahena sa pariggahaḥ iti pucchati a pariggahaḥ bho gotama ati ādīsu pi
translated: “With a possessor” means “with a male possessor.” “Without a possessor” means “without a male possessor.”

original: kāmacchandassa abhāvato itthipariggahena apariggaho. Byāpādassa abhāvato kenaci saddhiṃ🔽veracittena avero. Thinamiddhassa abhāvato cittagelaññasaṅkhātena byāpajjena abyāpajjo.
analyzed: kāmacchandassa abhāvataḥ itthi pariggahena apariggahaḥ byāpādassa abhāvataḥ kenaci saddhiṃ  vera cittena averaḥ thinam iddhassa abhāvataḥ citta gelañña saṅkhātena byāpajjena abyāpajjaḥ
translated: Because of the absence of ill will, he is without hatred towards anyone.🔽Because of the absence of sloth and torpor, he is without torpor, that is, without the kind of sluggishness of mind that is called “mental sluggishness” .

original: Uddhaccakukkuccābhāvato uddhaccakukkuccādīhi saṃkilesehi asaṃkiliṭṭhacitto suparisuddhamānaso.
analyzed: uddhacca kukkucca abhāvataḥ uddhacca kukkucca ādīhi saṃkilesehi asaṃkiliṭṭha cittaḥ su parisuddha mānasaḥ
translated: Because of the absence of agitation and worry, his mind is unclouded by the defilements called agitation and worry, and his mind is quite clear.

original: Vicikicchāya abhāvato cittaṃ vase vatteti. Yathā ca brāhmaṇā cittagatikā hontīti,
analyzed: vicikicchāya abhāvataḥ cittam vase vatta iti yathā ca brāhmaṇāḥ citta gatikāḥ honti iti
translated: Because of the absence of uncertainty, he has control over his mind. And just as the brahmans are said to be “mind-goers”

original: cittassa vasena vattanti, na tādisoti vasavattī.
analyzed: cittassa vasena vattanti na tādisaḥ ti vasa vattī
translated: because they go by the mind, he is not like that, thus he is a “mind-controller.”

original: 552. Idha kho panāti idha brahmalokamagge. Āsīditvāti amaggameva “maggo”ti upagantvā.🔽Saṃsīdantīti “samatala”nti saññāya paṅkaṃ otiṇṇā viya anuppavisanti. Saṃsīditvā visāraṃ
analyzed: idha kho pana ati idha brahma loka magge āsīditvā ati amaggam eva upagantvā  saṃsīdanti iti samatalanti saññāya paṅkam otiṇṇāḥ viya anuppavisanti saṃsīditvā visāram
translated: Here, however, means here in the path to the Brahma-world. Having settled down means having taken the path itself as the path.🔽They sink means they enter it as if they had sunk into mud, perceiving it as “even and smooth.” Having sunk means🔽having sunk as if into mud. They spread out means they spread out their limbs.

original: pāpuṇantīti evaṃ paṅke viya saṃsīditvā visāraṃ aṅgamaṅgasaṃbhañjanaṃ pāpuṇanti. Sukkhataraṃ
analyzed: pāpuṇanti iti evam paṅke viya saṃsīditvā visāram aṅgam aṅga saṃbhañjanam pāpuṇanti sukkhataram
translated: They reach a state of greater happiness

original: maññe tarantīti marīcikāya vañcetvā “kākapeyyā nadī”ti saññāya “tarissāmā”ti hatthehi🔽ca pādehi ca vāyamamānā sukkhataraṇaṃ maññe taranti. Tasmā yathā hatthapādādīnaṃ
analyzed: maññe taranti iti marīcikāya vañcetvā kākapeyyā nadī iti saññāya tarissāma ati hatthehi  ca pādehi ca vāyamamānā sukkha taraṇam maññe taranti tasmai yathā hattha pāda ādīnam
translated: They think they are crossing: they are deceived by the mirage, and thinking “It is a river,” they make a sign to each other that they will cross. They then strain themselves with their hands and feet, thinking they are crossing a river. Therefore, just as the hands, feet, etc.,

original: saṃbhañjanaṃ paribhañjanaṃ, evaṃ apāyesu saṃbhañjanaṃ paribhañjanaṃ pāpuṇanti. Idheva🔽ca sukhaṃ vā sātaṃ vā na labhanti. Tasmā idaṃ tevijjānaṃ brāhmaṇānanti tasmā idaṃ🔽brahmasahabyatāya maggadīpakaṃ tevijjakaṃ pāvacanaṃ tevijjānaṃ brāhmaṇānaṃ. Tevijjāiriṇanti🔽tevijjāaraññaṃ iriṇanti hi agāmakaṃ mahāaraññaṃ vuccati. Tevijjāvivananti pupphaphalehi🔽aparibhogarukkhehi sañchannaṃ nirudakaṃ araññaṃ. Yattha maggato ukkamitvā parivattitumpi
analyzed: saṃbhañjanam paribhañjanam evam apāyesu saṃbhañjanam paribhañjanam pāpuṇanti idhā iva  ca sukham vā sātam vā na labhanti tasmai idam tevijjānam brāhmaṇa ananti tasmai idam  brahma sahabyatāya maggadīpakam tevijjakam pāvacanam tevijjānam brāhmaṇānam  tevijjā araññam iriṇanti hi agāmakam mahā araññam vuccati puppha phalehi  a paribhoga rukkhehi sañchannam nirudakam araññam yattha maggataḥ ukkamitvā parivattitum pi
translated: They think they are crossing over: they are deceived by the mirage, and thinking “It is a river,” they think they will cross over. They make an effort with their hands and feet, and they think they are crossing over the dry ground. Therefore, just as the shaking and the shaking about of the hands, feet, etc.,

original: na sakkā honti, taṃ sandhāyāha “tevijjāvivanantipi vuccatī”ti. Tevijjābyasananti
analyzed: na sakkāḥ honti tam sandhāya āha vuccati iti
translated: so they reach the shaking and the shaking about in the states of loss. And they do not find pleasure or satisfaction right here. Therefore, this is for the brahmans of the three Vedas: therefore this teaching of the three Vedas, which illuminates the path to companionship with Brahmā, is for the brahmans of the three Vedas. The three-knowledge-jungle-thicket: the jungle-thicket is said to be a great jungle that is not frequented by people. The three-knowledge-forest: a forest that is overgrown with trees that do not bear flowers or fruit, and that is without water. Where, having gone off the path, one is not even able to turn around, that is what is meant by “it is also called the three-knowledge-forest.” The three-knowledge-disaster:

original: tevijjānaṃ pañcavidhabyasanasadisametaṃ. Yathā hi ñātirogabhoga diṭṭhi sīlabyasanappattassa
analyzed: pañcavidha byasana sadisam etam yathā hi ñāti roga bhoga sīla byasana ppattassa
translated: This is like the five kinds of misfortune of the three-knowledge brahmans.

original: sukhaṃ nāma natthi, evaṃ tevijjānaṃ tevijjakaṃ pāvacanaṃ āgamma sukhaṃ nāma natthīti dasseti.
analyzed: sukham nāma natthi evam tevijjānam tevijjakam pāvacanam āgamma sukham nāma natthi iti dasseti
translated: For just as one who has fallen into misfortune through relatives, disease, loss of property, views, or virtue has no happiness, so too, one who has come to the three-knowledge brahmans’ teaching has no happiness.

original: 554. Jātasaṃvaḍḍhoti jāto ca vaḍḍhito ca, yo hi kevalaṃ tattha jātova hoti, aññattha🔽vaḍḍhito, tassa samantā gāmamaggā na sabbaso paccakkhā honti, tasmā jātasaṃvaḍḍhoti
analyzed: jātasaṃvaḍḍho ti jāto ca vaḍḍhito ca yaḥ hi kevalam tattha jātaḥ uva hoti aññattha  vaḍḍhito tassa samantā gāma maggāḥ na sabbaso paccakkhāḥ honti tasmā jāta saṃvaḍḍho ti
translated: “Born and grown up”: born and grown up there. For one who is only born there but grown up elsewhere,🔽the village roads are not all familiar to him. Therefore he said “born and grown up.”

original: āha. Jātasaṃvaḍḍhopi yo ciranikkhanto, tassa na sabbaso paccakkhā honti. Tasmā “tāvadeva
analyzed: āha jāta saṃvaḍḍhaḥ api yaḥ cira nikkhanto tassa na sabbaso paccakkhāḥ honti tasmā tāvat eva
translated: Even one who is born and grown up there, if he has left home long ago, the village roads are not all familiar to him. Therefore he said “immediately set out.” The meaning is: he left at that very moment.

original: avasaṭa”nti āha, taṅkhaṇameva nikkhantanti attho. Dandhāyitattanti ayaṃ nu kho maggo,🔽ayaṃ na nukhoti kaṅkhāvasena cirāyitattaṃ. Vitthāyitattanti yathā sukhumaṃ atthajātaṃ
analyzed: āha taṅkhaṇam eva nikkhantanti attho ayam nu kho maggo  ayam na nukhas ti kaṅkhā vasena yathā sukhumam attha jātam
translated: “Because of slowness”: because of slowness due to doubt, thinking “Is this the road? Is this not the road?”

original: sahasā pucchitassa kassaci sarīraṃ thaddhabhāvaṃ gaṇhāti, evaṃ thaddhabhāvaggahaṇaṃ.
analyzed: sahasā pucchitassa kassaci sarīram thaddha bhāvam gaṇhāti evam thaddha bhāva ggahaṇam
translated: “Because of diffuseness”: just as when someone asks about a subtle matter, his body takes on a stiff state, so too, this is the taking on of a stiff state.

original: Na tvevāti iminā sabbaññutaññāṇassa appaṭihatabhāvaṃ dasseti. Tassa hi purisassa
analyzed: na tu eva iti iminā sabbaññu ta ññāṇassa appaṭihata bhāvam dasseti tassa hi purisassa
translated: By the words “not to speak of” he shows that the knowledge of omniscience is unobstructed. For this man

original: mārāvaṭṭanādivasena siyā ñāṇassa paṭighāto. Tena so dandhāyeyya vā vitthāyeyya vā.
analyzed: māra avaṭṭana ādi vasena siyā ñāṇassa paṭighāto tena saḥ dandhāyeyya vā vitthāyeyya vā
translated: “But not so the knowledge of the Omniscient One” shows the unobstructedness of the knowledge of omniscience. For that man’s knowledge might be obstructed by the Mara’s obstruction of the path, etc.,🔽and he might be slow or confused.

original: Sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ pana appaṭihataṃ, na sakkā tassa kenaci antarāyo kātunti dīpeti.
analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇam pana a paṭihatam na sakkā tassa kenaci antarāyaḥ kātunti dīpeti
translated: But the knowledge of omniscience is unobstructed; it is not possible for anyone to create an obstacle for it, is what is shown.

original: 555. Ullumpatu bhavaṃ gotamoti uddharatu bhavaṃ gotamo. Brāhmaṇiṃ pajanti brāhmaṇadārakaṃ,
analyzed: ullumpatu bhavam gotamaḥ iti uddharatu bhavam gotamaḥ brāhmaṇim pajanti brāhmaṇa dārakam
translated: “Let the Lord Gotama lift me out” means “Let the Lord Gotama rescue me.” The brahmin woman means the brahmin girl,

original: bhavaṃ gotamo mama brāhmaṇaputtaṃ apāyamaggato uddharitvā brahmalokamagge patiṭṭhapetūti
analyzed: bhavam gotamaḥ mama brāhmaṇa puttam apāya maggataḥ uddharitvā brahma loka magge patiṭṭhapetu uti
translated: the meaning being “Let the Lord Gotama rescue my brahmin son from the path of ruin and establish him on the path to the Brahma-world.”

original: attho. Athassa bhagavā buddhuppādaṃ dassetvā saddhiṃ pubbabhāgapaṭipadāya mettāvihārādibrahmalokagāmimaggaṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ atha assa bhagavā buddhuppādam dassetvā saddhim pubba bhāga paṭipadāya mettā vihāra ādi brahma loka gāmi maggaṃ
translated: Then the Exalted One, wishing to show the brahmin the arising of a Buddha together with the preliminary part of the path, and to teach him the path leading to the Brahma-world, beginning with the practice of loving-kindness,

original: desetukāmo “tena hi vāseṭṭhā”tiādimāha. Tattha “idha tathāgato”tiādi sāmaññaphale
analyzed: desetu kāmaḥ tena hi vāseṭṭha atiādim āha tattha idha tathāgato tiādi sāmañña phale
translated: said, “Then, Vasetthas,” etc. Herein, “Here, Vasetthas, a Tathagata arises in the world” is the fruit of recluseship.

original: vitthāritaṃ. Mettāsahagatenātiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ sabbaṃ visuddhimagge brahmavihārakammaṭṭhānakathāyaṃ
analyzed: vitthāritam mettā sahagatena ati ādīsu yat vattabbam tat sabbam visuddhi magge brahmavihāra kammaṭṭhāna kathā ayam
translated: and in detail. As to the words “accompanied by loving-kindness” and so on, what should be said has already been said in the Description of the Meditations in the Path of Purification.

original: vuttaṃ. Seyyathāpi vāseṭṭha balavā saṅkhadhamotiādi pana idha apubbaṃ. Tattha balavāti
analyzed: vuttam seyyathā api vāseṭṭha balavā saṅkhadhamā ti ādi pana idha apubbam tattha balavā ti
translated: But the passage beginning, “Or just as, Vasettha, a powerful trumpeter” is new here. Herein, powerful means

original: balasampanno. Saṅkhadhamoti saṅkhadhamako. Appakasirenāti akicchena adukkhena. Dubbalo🔽hi saṅkhadhamo saṅkhaṃ dhamantopi na sakkoti catasso disā sarena viññāpetuṃ, nāssa
analyzed: bala sampannaḥ saṅkha dhamo ti saṅkha dhamakaḥ appa kasirena ati akicchena adukkhena dubbalaḥ  hi saṅkha dhamaḥ saṅkham dhamantaḥ api na sakkoti catassaḥ disāḥ sarena viññāpetum
translated: endowed with power. Trumpeter means a trumpeter. With little trouble means with little difficulty, with little suffering.

original: saṅkhasaddo sabbato pharati. Balavato pana vipphāriko hoti, tasmā “balavā”tiādimāha.🔽Mettāya cetovimuttiyāti ettha mettāti vutte upacāropi appanāpi vaṭṭati, “cettovimuttī”ti
analyzed: saṅkha saddaḥ sabbatas pharati balavataḥ pana vipphārikaḥ hoti tasmā balavā iti ādim āha  mettāya cetaḥ vimuttiyā ti ettha mettā ati vutte upacāraḥ api appanā api vaṭṭati cettovimuttī iti
translated: For a weak trumpeter cannot make a trumpet sound by blowing into it a little, and the sound of his trumpet does not carry all round. But when he is powerful, it does. That is why he is called “powerful.”
